parameters: A... glass of water? For me?
Alright gladiator, let's make this quick.
No one's ever asked. I'm Briggum Knox, the Æther Isle bookkeeper—
Not a good look for a new recruit.
No! I'm not giving you my damn name until someone
tells me what the hell is going on around here!
Next question. How would you describe your fighting style?
I keep trying to tell you all— I am NOT a fighter.
I've never been in a fight in all my life! Who thought I would be
a good fit for gladiatorial contests?!
Last question. How would you describe your alignment?
Are you more of a \c[4]Hero\c[0] who fights for justice and defends the downtrodden,
a \c[6]Mercenary\c[0] who fights for their own selfish gains,
or a \c[2]Villain\c[0] who fights for the thrill of victory,
enjoying the harm you cause to others?
Gladiator says they are a \c[4]Hero\c[0] and according to the staff
Very well— take your key to the Hero House.
This will be your lodging during your stay here on Æther Isle.
After you leave this hut, head to the snowy island to the east.
The other heroes will onboard and prep you for training.
Gladiator says they are a \c[4]Hero\c[0] but according to the staff
That said— take your key to the Mercenary House.
This will be your lodging during your stay here on Æther Isle.

The other mercenaries will onboard and prep you for training.

That said— take your key to the Villain House.
This will be your lodging during your stay here on Æther Isle.
After you leave this hut, head to the snowy island to the east. You're the only \c[2]Villain\c[0]
on the island so you'll have to wait for Cort, your trainer, to call for you tomorrow.
We don't take kindly to \c[2]Villains\c[0] around here.
I suggest you tighten up if you want to last long on this island.

If you don't return me to my home now, I will relieve
the burden of that bulbous head from your shoulders.
Next question. How would you describe your fighting style?
I am the weapon. My ferocity is the "fighting style".

You see a list of names.
A potion. Will you try to steal it?
Really? Stealing MY property right in front of me?
A bucket of water... Looks dirty, but drinkable.
Would you like to collect a cup of water?
Hey! Hands off my water, gladiator.
The guard over there is thirsty. You should really be taking better
care of them if you expect them to protect you.
How dare you! Fine— take him a \c[14]glass of water\c[0] but then don't
By all means, ignore your dehydrated guard— \.but don't cry
to your commander when there's a mutiny among your ranks.

I didn't mean to offend but your guard seems extremely parched.
Shall I take him a drink?
